Class DjikstraRunnable

  • java.lang.Object
    • DjikstraRunnable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DjikstraRunnable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A runnable which calculates the best moves that can be made and stores them, ready to provide back to the ComputerPlayer that created the object. Implemented to allow for multi-threading in the Djikstra AI.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DjikstraRunnable(Piece[][] boardView, Piece colour, java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> freeSpaces, java.util.HashMap<Coordinate,java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate>> freeSpacesMap)
      Initialise the variables passed as parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<PotentialMove> getMoveOptions()
      Return the values for each potential move, as PotentialMove objects.
      boolean isDone()
      Indicates that the runnable has finished calculating the value of its allocated moves
      void run()
      Calculate the values of each move, 2 layers deep.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DjikstraRunnable

        public DjikstraRunnable(Piece[][] boardView,
                        Piece colour,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> freeSpaces,
                        java.util.HashMap<Coordinate,java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate>> freeSpacesMap)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        InvalidColourException
        Initialise the variables passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        boardView - The current state of the board
        colour - The colour of the AI player
        freeSpaces - The moves that are available to be made - does not represent all free spaces on the board, only those that the runnable is allocated to calculate value for.
        freeSpacesMap - The moves that are available for the second move for each first move
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - boardView, freeSpaces, or freeSpacesMap are null
        InvalidColourException - colour parameter is not Piece.RED or Piece.BLUE

    • Method Detail

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Indicates that the runnable has finished calculating the value of its allocated moves
        Returns:
        boolean indicating completion

      • getMoveOptions

        public java.util.ArrayList<PotentialMove> getMoveOptions()
        Return the values for each potential move, as PotentialMove objects. If not done calculating, return null.
        Returns:
        Null if not done calculating, else a list of PotentialMove options

      • run

        public void run()
        Calculate the values of each move, 2 layers deep. Assume the both players make the best move for themselves.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
